basics.name: Parham Moonesi Sohi
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A simple computer engineering student who's trying to live a quiet but purposeful life.

work.name: Saba System Sadra
work.summary: We work on websites and online services of different companies and try to find vulnerabilities and provide proof of concepts and furthermore, we propose how to fix them.

work.name: Saba System Sadra
work.summary: I was introduced to the theories behind penetration testing and learned about the keywords in this field. Moreover, I did some hands-on working on the hackthebox.com machines and challenges.

work.name: Danio.ir (former Eduland.ir) Educational Platform
work.summary: We designe the website from scratch using ReactJS but later immigrated to NextJS. My most notable work was the implementation of exercises and questions.

volunteer.organization: Principles and Applications of Artificial Intelligence
volunteer.summary: Edited and published course projects originally obtained from Berkley University and also, helped with extra guidance and supplementary material such as videos.
highlights: Under the supervision of Assistant Professor Mahdi Javanmardi

volunteer.summary: Was responsible to advise a group of students and collect and mark their workshop exercises.
highlights: Under the supervision of Assistant Professor Hossein Zeinali

volunteer.summary: Participated in designing programming exercises and recording workshop guide videos.
highlights: Under the supervision of Assistant Professor Bahador Bakhshi

education.institution: Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic), Tehran, Iran
courses: Principles and Applications of Artificial Intelligence

certificates.name: From Single Neuron to Learning in Networks
certificates.issuer: Institute for Research in Fundamental Sciences (IPM)

projects.name: Adversarial Robustness of Face Reconstruction Networks
projects.summary: We have read multiple articles on adversarial attacks and presented them. Right now, We are investigating the possibility of defending the reconstruction networks against the adversarial attack proposed in 'Privacy-preserving Adversarial Facial Features, Z Wang'.
highlights: Under the supervision of Assistant Professor Ahmad Nickabadi

projects.name: Alzheimer's disease detection using machine learning
projects.summary: As my B.Sc. I want to train three different machine learning models to detect Alzheimer's disease and compare them. I am currently in the data acquisition stage.
highlights: Under the supervision of Assistant Professor Ehsan Nazerfard

projects.name: Parasite Egg Detection in Animal Faeces
projects.summary: After we collected our data from a laboratory that had annotated their data in LableBox, we utilized different object detection models (YOLO, Faster RCNN and RetinaNet) for a parasite egg detection task. After comparing our different models, we chose the best one and deployed it on a web server using an Amazon EC2 instance.
